name: Le Touessrok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just got back from a perfect holiday at Le Touessrok. Our third time and definitely lucky because we received a complimentary upgrade to a Coral suite as it was my 60th birthday .
reviews.title: Paradise, nothing is too much trouble
A nice large "package" style family resort.
reviews.text: Staff who we hadn't seen for 14 years welcomed us back 'home'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone of the staff from the general manager to the cleaner made us welcome and took time to speak to us.
reviews.title: excellent services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So lovely to be treated so professionally by everyone we met, but also for their kindness and obvious love of their work. Some have been there 34 years, since the hotel opened and are very proud.
reviews.title: Honeymoon vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had free water each time we went to the beach or pool and they even clean your sunglasses!
reviews.title: Expectations exceeded by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, even tough a think it has lost some of its magic by changing ownership (is not One and Only anymore). Rooms are fine and food is correct (very good Indian restaurant). There are however too many kids, for those travelling in couples. The beach in front of the hotel is a little too small, if you want a good beach you must cross the bay by boat to Ilot mangenie, which sometimes could be unconvenient. The golf course is unbelievable, one of the best I have ever played in my life.
reviews.title: good hotel, magnificent golf course

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A superb resort with the most beautiful rooms on Frangipani island, split level with the bath looking over the lower level bedroom area and out to sea. Sitting in the bath with a glass of wine and a view of the ocean is recommended - the ultimate in chilling.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - 5 star plus but easy atmosphere

reviews.text: The Frangipani rooms have the added benefit of butler service. We were a little uneasy about this when we booked, as we thought it might be a bit pretentious - no such thing, they were wonderful and the butlers put you at ease immediately. The beach is as good as it looks and the beach service is excellent with complimentary drinks and ices at various points throughout the day.
reviews.title: Fabulous, but expensive!

reviews.text: Ilot Mangenie, a private island, is a must. When you get off the boat uniformed men spray your face with rose water, sunglasses are removed and cleaned and you are taken to your preferred sun lounger while being provided with a lemon scented towel to wipe your hands on! It's a class apart. I wish we had gone earlier in our stay as I would have used the facilities more.
reviews.title: Great location and facilties but the main dining room poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On IIe aux Cerfs island is the most beautiful course. We are not golfers, but we did take advantage of a demonstration and tuition by the Pro – definitely worth the visit.
reviews.title: Excellent as ever.

reviews.text: Went with a 5 month old baby and an older mother. First of all hotel is totally unsuitable for young children or older clients as steps everywhere especially to go to reception or restaurant. Staff totally uninterested to help carry pushchair be it at reception or restaurants. Had to wait or ask several times. Not a leading hotel of the world by any means. Main pool is tiny and not enough sun loungers.
reviews.title: Definitely not a five star hotel

reviews.text: Bars are a let down, pricey and plain cocktails. Restaurant's main buffet food pretty boring after two weeks.
reviews.title: Ideal from 9 months to 90!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff most rude ever. Complacent and unhelpful. I moved from frangipani to hibiscus after a week to have direct beach access. First I was told room would be ready at 2pm, then it was 5 pm, no explanations given. Despite asking for packing and unpacking by butler on pre arrival form no help given. The worse had to be when the senior reception staff assured me there was only one step from the room terrace to the beach that could be managed with a pushchair and for me to realise there were actually stairs with 4 steps which I could never manage with the pushchair. Reception staff were plain deceitful or just don't know what they are talking about. Either way not what I was expecting from a five star hotel.
reviews.title: Welcome to perfect paradise

reviews.text: My advice don't go there on honeymoon, crowded and nothing special. Don't go with young children or older parents either as you will struggle to get anywhere.
reviews.title: The Only Hotel to Stay At

reviews.text: This was our 3rd visit to le touessrok and it has never disappointed us. It's always the place my kids want to return to above all others.
reviews.title: A very nice resort with wonderful beaches
A resort for all
reviews.text: Le Touessrok is a big resort built around a shallow lagoon with 200 rooms/suites scattered along mainland beaches and on Frangipani island. It provides direct boat transfer to the popular Ile Aux Cerfs island where the golf course is located, as well as its own private Ilot Mangenie island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort suits everyone with its many features. Families with children like to gather around the main swimming pool and the sandy beach where swimming in the lagoon is fun and safe. There is a separate pool in a quiet zone for adults and the Givenchy spa offers a variety of pampering treatments.
reviews.title: Unbeatable on service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those seeking water sports and activities, choices are many while the Ilot Mangenie island has many beautiful and isolated beaches for peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Touessrok gets the job done. But...

reviews.text: My junior suite sitated at the end of Frangipai island with a lovely view of both the ocean and the lagoon. The bathroom was huge -- I particularly enjoyed relaxing in the large oval-shaped free standing bathtub sipping champage watching the blue sky through the balcony windows.
reviews.title: Superb hotel & service

reviews.text: The first night I dined at the half board 398 restaurant which was full of hustle and bustle. It was of buffet style with a huge selection of food and several counters offering quick-cooking at request. My own preference was for the quieter and atmospheric Barlen's beachfront restaurant where a la carte menu was served and waiters provided more personal and attentive service.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with a soul

aka: Le Touessrok Hotel Trou d`Eau Douce
description: Le Touessrok is one of the world's great romantic resorts. Sensuous and chic, it is the essence of cool, modern elegance basking in the cultural warmth of tropical Mauritius. The resort is set on a beautiful stretch of white-sand coastline overlooking the tranquil Trou d'Eau Douce bay. On the mainland are the suites and rooms, pools, restaurants and bars, Givenchy Spa, tennis and the kids club.Across the water are the resort's two islands - Ile aux Cerfs, with its spectacular championship golf course designed by Bernard Langer, and Ilot Mangenie, an island retreat exclusive to guests, both a short ride by private boat.
